listings.title: Olympic Games
listings.text: The Olympic Games are an athletic festival that originated in ancient Greece and were revived in the late 19th century. They are the world’s foremost sports competition and include athletes from all over the world.

listings.title: The ancient Olympic Games
listings.text: The ancient Olympic Games were held every four years at Olympia, Greece. The first recorded Olympic champion was Coroebus of Elis, who won the sprint race in 776 BCE.

listings.title: The modern Olympic movement
listings.text: The modern Olympic Games were revived in the late 19th century, with the first modern Games held in Athens in 1896. Pierre de Coubertin is credited with the revival.

listings.title: History of the modern Summer Games
listings.text: The modern Summer Olympic Games have been held every four years since 1896, except during World Wars I and II.

listings.title: History of the Olympic Winter Games
listings.text: The first Olympic Winter Games took place in Chamonix, France, in 1924, and they have been held every four years since.
